result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wilson J. Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Wilson J. Miller was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's supervision revoked on 8-31-17; no unpaid financial obligations

10:23 a.m. Cases called: 16CF50 & 16CF566, Defendant Wilson J. Miller in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&3 in 16CF50. Factual basis established. Atty. Riek entered NGI pleas to counts 2&3. Court accepted NGI pleas. Victim impact statement filed. Ct. 1 dismissed and 16CF566 dismissed. Orders for Commitment filed - one for count 1 and one for count 2.  Court found defendant eligible for conditional release immediately. DHS to prepare treatment plan.  State recommended 12 months on each count, consecutive to each other. Status conference to be set three weeks from now. Court adjourned at 10:44 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Of Discharge filed. Mailed to MMH
